Name: Sakena Abedin
Research Interest: 20th century U.S. medicine; medicine and the social sciences; race and medicine; history of the U.S. healthcare system; healthcare in New Haven
Position: Lecturer in the History of Science and Medicine

Name: Paola Bertucci
Research Interest: Enlightenment; cultural history of technology in the early modern world, cultures of collecting and display; artisanal knowledge, the early modern body, scientific travel, material culture
Position: Associate Professor of History and History of Medicine; Curator of the History of Science and Technology Division, Peabody Museum; Director of Graduate Studies (Spring 2021)

Name: Deborah Coen
Research Interest: History of the modern physical and environmental sciences; Central European intellectual and cultural history
Position: Professor, Chair of the History of Science & Medicine Program; Director of Graduate Studies (Fall 2020)

Name: Ivano Dal Prete
Research Interest: Early history of the Earth sciences (1200-1800); Renaissance scientific literature in the vernacular; generation in the long eighteenth century; material and visual culture of astronomy and natural history; science, religion and society
Position: Lecturer in History, Director of Undergraduate Studies 2020-2021

Name: Nana Osei Quarshie
Research Interest: West Africa; Medicine; Migration and Political Expulsions; Urbanization

Name: Joanna Radin
Research Interest: Global histories of biology, ecology, medicine, and anthropology since 1945; history and anthropology of life and death; biomedical technology and computing; feminist, indigenous, and queer STS; science fiction
Position: Associate Professor of History of Medicine and History, and History and Anthropology

Name: Chitra Ramalingam
Research Interest: History and theory of photography, cultural history of the physical sciences (18th-century to the present), science and visual culture, visual studies, material culture studies, modern British history, science and empire, museum studies
Position: Associate Curator of Photography, Yale Center for British Art / Lecturer, HSHM and History

Name: Bill Rankin
Research Interest: Physical and earth sciences since the mid-nineteenth century; military, industrial, and governmental science; history of cartography; science and architecture; visual studies; environmental history
Position: Associate Professor of the History of Science

Name: Miriam Rich
Research Interest: History of U.S. medicine, biology, and public health; race, gender, and biomedicine; reproduction and reproductive health; pain, bodies, and disability; citizenship and healthcare; medical ethics
Position: Lecturer in the History of Medicine

Name: Carolyn Roberts
Research Interest: Medicine and slavery in the Atlantic world; race, medicine, and science; history of medicine in Africa and the African diaspora; health and protest in African American history; non-Western medicine and global health
Position: Assistant Professor of African American Studies, History and History of Medicine; Senior Project Director, HSHM

Name: Naomi Rogers
Research Interest: History of 20th century medicine & public health in North America including policy, activism, alternative medicine & gender and medicine; Science & feminism; Feminist health movements
Position: Professor of the History of Medicine and History, Director of Graduate Studies

Name: John Harley Warner
Research Interest: 19th & 20th century US medicine and health; Comparative history of medicine (US, Britain, France); Cultural history of science & medicine
Position: Avalon Professor of the History of Medicine; Professor of History and of American Studies; Chair of the Section of the History of Medicine (School of Medicine)
